intro: Dasystephana fetissowii, commonly known as the Hainan star-anise, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are glossy and lance-shaped, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
